Package javelin.model.world.location.town

Class Town

  • java.lang.Object
    • javelin.model.world.Actor
      • javelin.model.world.location.Location
        • javelin.model.world.location.town.Town
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    public class Town
extends Location
    A hub for upgrading units, resting, participating in tournament, renting transportation, buying items... Each town has it's own profile which is predetermined. TODO maybe override Location.getel(Integer) to return at least population so that weak Incursions won't take big towns TODO keeping track of city names is pretty bad when it comes to diplomacy - instead just have it be fire hamlet/water city and print their colors on the world map
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • DAILYLABOR

        public static final float DAILYLABOR
        How much Labor a single work produces in one day ( 0.10999999940395355f). The goal here is to have a Town controlled by a Governor be around population 20 by the end of 1 year. The best of verifying this with some degree of flexibility is to just verify that at the end of year 1, the town populations are between 16 and 25.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • events

        public java.util.ArrayList<Exhibition> events
        See Also:
        HostTournament

      • population

        public int population
        Represents the size of a town. In Campaign games this is expected to go from roughly 1 to 20 in the span of a year. Default is 1
        See Also:
        Scenario.populate(Town, boolean)

        public java.util.TreeSet<java.lang.String> traits

      • getdistrict

        public District getdistrict()
        Description copied from class: Actor
        Note that this could return a hostile town!
        Overrides:
        getdistrict in class Actor
        Returns:
        A Town district this location is part of or null if it is not located inside one. If more than one district encompasses this location, the one with the highest population will be returned.

      • getcombatants

        public java.util.List<Combatant> getcombatants()
        Specified by:
        getcombatants in class Actor
        Returns:
        Any combatants that are situated in this actor, may return null if this is not a valid request for this type of actor. For performance if a List is returned it should be the canonical one, and thus should not be directly modified by the receiver.
        See Also:
        Combatant.newid()

        @Deprecated
public void sethappiness​(float happiness)
        Deprecated.
        Should only be used for debug purposes.

      • generatereputation

        public int generatereputation()
        Each town generates Diplomacy.reputation according to three factors: number of resources and happiness (both of which only count if the town is not hostile) and its Relationship.status.
        Returns:
        0 or more reputation points based on happiness and resources. Reputation never goes down so negative values are returned as zero.
        See Also:
        Location.ishostile(), Diplomacy.getdiscovered()

      • dealevent

        public void dealevent()
        Generates and process UrbanEvents, if any. It should be unlikely but entirely possible that two towns have an event on the same day.
        Throws:
        StartBattle - For some events.

      • notifyplayer

        public boolean notifyplayer()
        Returns:
        true if the player should receive full information on the happenings of this town, false if it isn't conceivable that he would have access to these.
        See Also:
        Location.ishostile()

      • populate

        public void populate​(int el)
        Parameters:
        el - Generates an initial Location.garrison from this suggested Encounter Level. This will be convered from a base EL to a party-equivalent EL.
        See Also:
        Scenario.populate(Town, boolean)
